title: Tree-Based Model Superiority Analysis
key_findings: Tree-based models achieve superior performance (R² ≥ 0.85) compared to neural networks
SHAP interpretability provides clear feature importance rankings with physical meaning
Hardness-toughness-thermal property synergies control ballistic performance
Feature importance rankings align with established materials science principles
Natural threshold modeling captures ceramic-specific behaviors effectively

literature_references.title: A general-purpose machine learning framework for predicting properties of inorganic materials
Ballistic performance of armour ceramics: Influence of design and structure
A review of ceramics for armor applications

evidence_summary.performance_evidence: Consistent R² ≥ 0.85 achievement across ceramic systems
evidence_summary.interpretability_evidence: Clear SHAP feature importance with physical validation
evidence_summary.efficiency_evidence: Superior performance with limited datasets (<1000 samples)
evidence_summary.materials_alignment: Feature rankings match materials science principles
